page.title: 06RAISING OF THE ARRETON COW
page.content: THE ARRETON COW IS A HUNDRED YEAR OLD TRAMP STEAMER WHICH HAS BEEN PARKED IN BULLO PILL HARBOUR FOR THE LAST THREE YEARS.GRADUALLY THE SILT FROM THE RIVER SEVERN LEFT THE ARRETON COW ON A SIX FOOT HIGH MUD BANK.THE OWNER,MR STAMP,HAD GOT A CONTRACT FOR DREDGING IN THE BRISTOL CHANNEL AND HAD TO SPEND THREE WEEKS DIGGING THE OLD SHIP OUT.THIS WAS BEING DONE WITH A JCB.MR STAMP HAD SPECIALLY EXTENDED THE ARM BY FOUR FEET TO REACH OVER THE SIDE DEEP INTO THE MUD;THE HOLD OF THE ARRETON COW WOULD BE USED TO CARRY THE MUD FAR OUT INTO THE BRISTOL CHANNEL.THE LAST TIME WE WERE THERE,THE ARRETON COW FLOATED FOR A FEW MINUTES ON THE HIGH TIDE.THE ARRETON COW WAS ABOUT TO START A NEW LIFE.
